title: How to Say Happy Birthday in Turkish

steps.title: İyi ki doğdun.
steps.content: İyi ki doğdun. In Turkish the letter "ğ" means lengthen the o and the u and merge them into one. It doesn't have a sound of its own, though. This is pronounced eey-ki dough-doon . The oo is like the oo in book. The gh must be very soft, like the gh in "Bread Dough". The basic meaning of this is "It's a good thing you were born." [1] X Research source

steps.title: Mutlu yıllar.
steps.content: Mutlu yıllar. In Turkish, the letter "ı" is like a cross between the u in umbrella and the oo in book. It is pronounced moot-loo yull-larr . In this one, trill the r. The oo is, again, like the oo in book. The basic meaning is "Happy years." This need not necessarily be limited to birthdays, though. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Doğum günün kutlu olsun.
steps.content: Doğum günün kutlu olsun. The ü is the oo in book leaning over just a bit to sound like ee. Again, the ğ makes a soft gh sound, like the gh in Bread Dough. This is pronounced do-wum goonoon kootloo olsun. The basic meaning is "May your birthday be celebrated." [3] X Research source
